definition: unable or unwilling to perceive or understand, a protective covering that keeps things out or hinders sight, to make dim by comparison or conceal
details:
adjective
- unable or unwilling to perceive or understand
= example: unable or unwilling to perceive or understand
- not based on reason or evidence
= example: not based on reason or evidence
= synonyms: unreasoning
- unable to see
= example: unable to see
= synonyms: unsighted
noun
- a protective covering that keeps things out or hinders sight
= example: a protective covering that keeps things out or hinders sight
= synonyms: screen
- a hiding place sometimes used by hunters, especially duck hunters
= example: a hiding place sometimes used by hunters, especially duck hunters
- something intended to misrepresent the true nature of an activity
= synonyms: subterfuge
- people who have severe visual impairments, considered as a group
= example: people who have severe visual impairments, considered as a group
verb
- to make dim by comparison or conceal
= example: to make dim by comparison or conceal
= synonyms: dim
- to make blind by putting the eyes out
= example: to make blind by putting the eyes out
- to render unable to see
= example: to render unable to see
